==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|slüzzel}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|sluzzil}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*slutilaz}}, which is derived from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*sleutaną||to close}}. Cognate to {{cog|nl|sleutel}} and {{cog|en|slot}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃlʏsl̩/|/ˈʃlʏsəl/}} * {{hyphenation|de|Schlüs|sel}} * {{audio|de|De-Schlüssel.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m||Schlüssel|Schlüsselchen}} # a [[key]] #: ''Der '''Schlüssel''' passt nicht.'' #:: The '''key''' doesn't fit. #: ''Diese beiden '''Schlüssel''' sind identisch.'' #:: These two '''keys''' are identical. #* '''1922''', [[w:Franz Kafka|Franz Kafka]], ''[[s:de:Das Schloß|Das Schloß]]'', [[w:de:Kurt Wolff Verlag|Kurt Wolff Verlag]] (1926), page 241: #*: Es war zwar ein großer Holzvorrat in einem Schuppen vorhanden, dieser Schuppen aber war versperrt und den '''Schlüssel''' hatte der Lehrer, der eine Entnahme des Holzes nur für das Heizen während der Unterrichtsstunden gestattete. #*:: There was a large supply of wood available in a shed, but this shed was locked and the key was in the possession of the teacher, who allowed taking from the wood only for the heating during the class hours. # a [[bunch]] of keys; {{ngd|grammatically singular, used instead of {{m|de|Schlüsselbund}}, especially with possessive determiner}} #: ''Ich habe meinen '''Schlüssel''' irgendwo vergessen.'' #:: I left my '''keys''' (= the bunch I usually carry) somewhere. #: ''Ich habe einen Einkaufschip am '''Schlüssel.''''' #:: I have a trolley token on my '''bunch of keys'''. # ''Short for certain compounds, such as'' {{m|de|Schraubenschlüssel||screw-wrench}} ''or'' {{m|de|Notenschlüssel||clef}}. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s}} ====Hyponyms==== {{col3|de|title=Hyponyms of „Schlüssel“
